title: Old vintage font needed help
content:
Hi there, I'm looking for the font at the bottom of the field that writes "Steve Harrington" the roman and the italic version, as i suppose this one is the italic  
thanks in advance

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015044654im_/http:/typophile.com/files/harrington_sleeve-corduroy_5433.jpg)
author: heyzuppals

comments.content:
That's ITC Bookman medium or demi italic, with swash alternate characters included.  
 [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=44276](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015044654/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=44276 "http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=44276")  
You may require both the italic and swash italic fonts to get all the needed glyphs.

Cheers,

T

Extremely thanks Mr. Thomas  
now i have another doubt  
i have found ITC Bookman on my Font Folio folders but none of this variations contain the glyphs or ornaments which is what i'm needing more.

No, Adobe's version does not have the swash alternates. That's why I posted the link to the Monotype/ITC site, fonts.com. Adobe licenses the typeface from Monotype/ITC, who recently made the swash alternates available in digital form.

Cheers,

T
